intro: Ilex kunmingensis, commonly known as the Kunming holly, is a species of evergreen shrub or small tree native to China. It belongs to the family Aquifoliaceae and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and small, red berries. The plant is typically found in subtropical regions, growing in moist, well-drained soils. It has a compact growth habit and is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and winter interest. Ilex kunmingensis is also valued for its ecological role in supporting local wildlife.
